p: PPRV infects domestic as well as wild ruminants with goats and sheep being the most susceptible domestic animals and which also serve as primary hosts. The disease has been reported to be more severe in goats than in sheep, although this claim still lacks scientific proof [ 35]. Transmission of PPRV occurs through direct contact with infected animals, inhalation of aerosol (expectorate), or contacts with lacrimal secretions, nasal exudates, saliva and faeces.
